metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15219 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.1.8. There is a NULL pointer dereference caused by a malicious USB device in the drivers/usb/misc/sisusbvga/sisusb.c driver.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15219` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1047-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49
No subscription required

linux-image-5.0.0-1021-aws - 5.0.0-1021.24~18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Setting priority to negligible since this simple DoS requires a malicious USB device to be inserted into the system

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-60.67').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49').
linux-aws-5.0 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1021.24~18.04.1').
